name: Hegel AI
headline: Open source tools for developing generative AI applications
description:
We build tools for developing applications with generative AI models. Whether you are using LLMs, vector databases, and text-to-image models like Stable Diffusion, our tools help you find the right model, prompt, configuration and consistently monitor their behaviors in production.

---

**PromptTools**: the first open-source, developer-focused SDK for experimenting with and evaluating prompts, models, and vector databases. You can try the repo here: https://github.com/hegelai/prompttools. If you're building with LLMs and struggling with evaluation, reach out and we can help.

founders.name: Kevin Tse, Founder
founders.description:
Building open-source developer tools for large language models at Hegel AI. Previously worked on PyTorch at Meta AI and quantitative development at Bridgewater Associates. Studied at Computer Science and Economics at UChicago.

Happy to connect and chat about how your company is using AI and LLMs!

generated_description:
**Hegel AI** is a fresh player in the generative AI landscape, founded in 2023 and currently operating within Y Combinator’s S23 batch. Their mission? To create open-source tools that empower developers to build and refine applications using generative AI models, including large language models (LLMs) and cutting-edge technologies like Stable Diffusion for text-to-image tasks.

**Key Offering: PromptTools**  
At the core of Hegel AI's initiative is **PromptTools**, the first open-source SDK specifically designed for developers to experiment with prompts and evaluate various models and vector databases. This tool is geared towards helping developers navigate the complexities of LLMs—enabling them to monitor performance in production, gather custom metrics, and iterate based on feedback. Interested developers can check it out [here](https://github.com/hegelai/prompttools).

From the get-go, Hegel AI is focused on practicality: their platform not only facilitates the development of AI prompts and models but also integrates features for monitoring and enhancing these systems over time. They aim to streamline the evaluation processes by allowing teams to annotate responses, leverage human-in-the-loop mechanisms, and utilize LLMs for automated assessments.

**Who’s Behind Hegel AI?**  
With a lean team of 2 employees, Hegel AI embodies the startup hustle. Their guiding light, Harj Taggar, is a Group Partner at Y Combinator, hinting at the company's strong mentorship and support network.

**Current Focus**  
As they develop their platform, they’re keen on providing tools that support integration with almost every available LLM, vector database, and framework. Furthermore, they’re excited to serve various use cases across industries and company sizes.

In summary, Hegel AI is tapping into the potential of generative AI by making it accessible through open-source innovations. Their commitment to creating effective and user-friendly tools for LLM applications puts them on a promising path—one that could reshape how developers approach AI application development. Keep your eyes on them; with such a focused mission and agile execution, Hegel AI is definitely a name to remember in the ever-evolving AI landscape. 

For more info, you can visit their [website](https://hegel-ai.com).
